comments.author: Andy M

comments.text:
What makes this movie my favorite zombie film of all time (aside from its 
own glorious merits) is that I love how it encapsulates the whole "Living 
Dead" Trilogy by George Romero:

NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD: Similar cause of the zombie plague, in "Night" it 
was the outer space radiations brought by a satellite returning from Venus, 
in "Shaun" you can hear at the radio that some spacecraft crashed in 
Britain. Then of course there's a character named Barbara... "We're coming 
to get you, Barbara!"

DAWN OF THE DEAD: Aside from the title itself, "Shaun" kinda reprises the 
whole idea about using zombies to satirize society and our everyday life.
Oh, and at the end "The Gonk" music can be heard.

DAY OF THE DEAD: The characters hiding in the basement is kinda like a 
small-sized version of the underground military base of "Day", and at the 
end (SPOILERS) Shaun keeping zombie-Ed and teaching him how to play 
videogames seems like a homage to Dr. Logan and Bub, his 'trained' zombie.﻿
